theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of senescent cells, SASP secretion, and their systemic impact on aging and inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescent cell accumulation in bone, SASP effects, and resistance to apoptosis contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes senescent cells in bone microenvironment, SASP-driven inflammation, and therapeutic clearance effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights senescent cell EV secretion as part of SASP and systemic aging communication.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescence growth arrest, DNA damage response, and SASP in T cell aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescent cell accumulation, SCAPs anti-apoptotic pathways, SASP, and senolytic therapies.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: General overview of senescence as stable growth arrest, accumulation with age, and metabolically active SASP phenotype.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details stable cell cycle arrest, SASP secretion, senescent cell accumulation, and contribution to age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescence growth arrest, SASP, DNA damage, and interaction with innate immunity in brain aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence as aging driver, SASP promoting inflammation and cancer, and tumor suppressor pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescent cell accumulation in skin, SASP-driven inflammaging, and immune cell cross-talk.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial role in senescence and SASP, linking senescence to tissue dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tumor Suppressor Pathways and Senescence Growth Arrest Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on irreversible growth arrest, tumor suppressor pathways (p16Ink4a/Rb, p53/p21), and senescence as tumor suppression.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tumor Suppressor Pathways and Senescence Growth Arrest Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes chromatin remodeling (SAHF), pRB and p53 pathways enforcing stable senescence growth arrest and tumor suppression.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tumor Suppressor Pathways and Senescence Growth Arrest Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details Ink4/Arf locus role in tumor suppression, senescence regulation, and anti-aging effects via quiescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tumor Suppressor Pathways and Senescence Growth Arrest Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oncogene-induced senescence, telomere shortening, DNA damage, and immune clearance in tumor suppression.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tumor Suppressor Pathways and Senescence Growth Arrest Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes finite replicative capacity of normal cells as intrinsic aging mechanism linked to senescence and tumor cell immortalization.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and DNA Damage-Induced Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative stress causing senescence, lipofuscin accumulation, and genetic mutations accelerating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and DNA Damage-Induced Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes neutrophil ROS causing telomere oxidation (TelOxidation), telomere dysfunction, and senescence induction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and DNA Damage-Induced Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details DNA damage response, p53 role in DDR, persistent damage causing senescence, and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and DNA Damage-Induced Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on p53 regulation of oxidative stress responses, balancing antioxidant and prooxidant activities affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Reprogramming and Mitochondrial Dysfunction-Associated Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes metabolic changes in senescent cells, mitochondrial dysfunction-associated senescence (MiDAS), and SASP regulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Reprogramming and Mitochondrial Dysfunction-Associated Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on neuronal senescence driven by proteostasis failure, mTOR regulation, and neuroprotective senescence phenotype.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Reprogramming and Mitochondrial Dysfunction-Associated Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes Caveolin-1 deficiency causing mTOR hyperactivation, mitochondrial dysfunction, and stromal aging promoting tumor growth.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Reprogramming and Mitochondrial Dysfunction-Associated Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on autophagy decline with age, its regulation by longevity pathways, and impact on cellular homeostasis and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Reprogramming and Mitochondrial Dysfunction-Associated Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes noncanonical autophagy gene functions in neuronal waste extrusion and lifespan extension, linking autophagy to aging.
